column1:
[The following appeared in a computer magazine in Mr. Dvorak''s
column:

\n

Dear Mr. Dvorak:

\n

Ann Landers wouldn''t print this. I have nowhere else to turn. I
have to get the word out. Warn other parents. I must be rambling
on. Let me try and explain. It''s about my son
column2:
Billy. He''s
always been a good
column3: normal ten year old boy. Well
column4:
last spring
we sat down after dinner to select a summer camp for Billy. We
sorted through the camp brochures. There were the usual camps
with swimming
column5: canoeing
column6: games
column7:
singing by the campfire--you
know. There were sports camps and specialty camps for weight
reduction
column8: music
column9:
military camps and camps that specialized in
Tibetan knot tying.

\n

I tried to talk him into Camp Winnepoopoo. It''s where he went
last year. (He made an adorable picture out of painted pinto
beans and macaroni). Billy would have none of it. Billy pulled a
brochure out of his pocket. It was for a COMPUTER CAMP! We
should have put our foot down right there
column10:
if only we had known.
He left three weeks ago. I don''t know what''s happened. He''s
changed. I can''t explain it. See for yourself. These are some of
my little Billy''s letters.

\n

**********
Dear Mom
column11:
The kids are dorky nerds. The food stinks. The computers are the
only good part. We''re learning how to program. Late at night is
the best time to program
column12:
so they let us stay up.
Love
column13:
Billy.

\n

**********
Dear Mom
column14:
Camp is O.K. Last night we had pizza in the middle of the night.
We all get to choose what we want to drink. I drink Classic
Coke. By the way
column15:
can you make Szechuan food? I''m getting used
to it now. Gotta go
column16:
it''s time for the flowchart class.
Love
column17:
Billy.
P.S. This is written on a word processor. Pretty swell
column18:
huh?
It''s spell checked too.

\n

**********
Dear Mom
column19:
Don''t worry. We do regular camp stuff. We told ghost stories by
the glow of the green computer screens. It was real neat. I
don''t have much of a tan ''cause we don''t go outside very often.
You can''t see the computer screen in the sunlight anyway. That
wimp camp I went to last year fed us weird food too. Lay off
column20: Mom. I''m okay
column21:
really.
Love
column22:
Billy.

\n

**********
Dear Mom
column23:
I''m fine. I''m sleeping enough. I''m eating enough. This is the
best camp ever. We scared the counselor with some phony worm
code. It was real funny. He got mad and yelled. Frederick says
it''s okay. Can you send more money? I spent mine on a pocket
protector and a box of blank diskettes. I''ve got to chip in on
the phone bill. Did you know that you can talk to people on a
computer? Give my regards to Dad.
Love
column24:
Billy.

\n

**********
Dear Mother
column25:
Forget the money for the telephone. We''ve got a way to not pay.
Sorry I haven''t written. I''ve been learning a lot. I''m real good
at getting onto any computer in the country. It''s really easy! I
got into the university''s in less than fifteen minutes.
Frederick did it in five
column26:
he''s going to show me how. Frederick
is my bunk partner. He''s really smart. He says that I shouldn''t
call myself Billy anymore. So
column27:
I''m not.
Signed
column28:
William.

\n

**********
Dear Mother
column29:
How nice of you to come up on Parents Day. Why''d you get so
upset? I haven''t gained that much weight. The glasses aren''t
real. Everybody wears them. I was trying to fit in. Believe me
column30:
the tape on them is cool. I thought that you''d be proud of my
program. After all
column31:
I''ve made some money on it. A publisher is
sending a check for $30
column32: 000. Anyway
column33:
I''ve paid for the next six
weeks of camp. I won''t be home until late August.
Regards
column34:
William.

\n

**********
Mother
column35:
Stop treating me like a child. True--physically I am only ten
years old. It was silly of you to try to kidnap me. Do not try
again. Remember
column36:
I can make your life miserable (i.e. - the
bank
column37: credit bureau
column38:
and government computers). I am not
kidding. O.K.? I won''t write again and this is your only
warning. The emotions of this interpersonal communication drain
me.
Sincerely
column39:
William.

\n

**********

\n

See what I mean? It''s been two weeks since I''ve heard from my
little boy. What can I do
column40:
Mr. Dvorak? I know that it''s probably
too late to save my little Billy. But
column41:
if by printing these
letters you can save JUST ONE CHILD from a life of programming
column42: please
column43:
I beg of you to do so. Thank you very much.

\n

Sally Gates
column44:
\n

Concerned Parent]

column1: [The other day I went to the local religious book store where I saw a "HONK IF YOU LOVE JESUS" bumper sticker. I bought it and put it on my back bumper and I''m glad I did. What an uplifting experience followed. That bumper sticker really worked!!I found lots of people who loved Jesus. I was stopped at the light at a busy intersection
column2: just lost in thought about the Lord. Why
column3: the guy behind me started to honk like crazy. He must REALLY love Jesus because pretty soon he leaned out of his window and yelled "JESUS CHRIST!" as loud as he could. It was like a football game with him shouting
column4: "GO!...JESUS CHRIST!...GO!" Everyone else started honking too
column5: so I leaned out the window and smiled and waved to all those loving people. There must have been a guy from Florida back there because I heard him yell something about a sunny beach and saw him waving with only his middle finger. I asked my kids what he meant by that and they laughed and said it was the Hawaiian good luck sign. So I leaned out of the window and gave him the good luck sign back. A couple of people were so caught up in the joy of the moment that they got out of their cars and started running towards me! I bet they wanted to pray
column6: but just then I noticed that the light had changed so I stepped on the gas. It''s a good thing that I did because I was the only driver to get across the intersection. I looked back and everyone was still standing there so I leaned way out the window and held up the Hawaiian good luck sign as I drove away. Praise the Lord for such wonderful people!]

[For all you health nuts out there: 1) My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was 60. She''s 97 now & we don''t know where the heck she is.2) The only reason I would take up jogging is so that I could hear heavy breathing again.3) I joined a health club last year
column2: spent about 400 bucks. Haven''t lost a pound. Apparently you have to show up.4) I have to exercise in the morning before my brain figures out what I''m doing.5) I don''t exercise at all. If God meant us to touch our toes
column3: he would have put them further up our body.6) I like long walks
column4: especially when they are taken by people who annoy me.7) I have flabby thighs
column5: but fortunately my stomach covers them.8) The advantage of exercising every day is that you die healthier.9) If you are going to try cross-country skiing
column6: start with a small country.10) I don''t jog. It makes the ice jump right out of my glass.]

[Q: How can you tell that President Clinton is sure he''s going to be re-elected?

A: He started dating again!

Q: How can you tell that the guy who attacked the White House with a plane was insane?

A: Apparently he thought President Clinton would be in his own bedroom at night.

Q: What did Bill Clinton say when asked about the campaign promises he broke?

A: "They seemed kinda like marriage vows."

Q: What was Bill Clinton''s favorite part of the Olympics?

A: The Opening Ceremonies because it was the only time he could be around an old flame and not have to dodge allegations.

After a meeting with the Pope
column2: Bill Clinton held a press conference and announced that they had a very successful conference and had agreed on about 60% of what they discussed. When asked what they discussed
column3:
Clinton replied: "The Ten commandments."

Q: How is Bill Clinton like an unemployed school teacher?

A: He has no class and no principals.

Q: Why aren''t Clinton White House staffers given coffee breaks?

A: It takes too long to retrain them.]

column10:
hit the pulse button and let the spray blast

2. Slam your thumb in a car door. Don''t go see a doctor.

1. Repeat all of the above every Saturday and Sunday until it''s time for

column1:
[George W. Bush
The White House
1600 Pennsylvania Ave.
column2:
NW
Washington
column3:
D.C. 20500

\n

Past Work Experience

\n

Ran for congress and lost.
Produced a Hollywood slasher B movie.
Bought an oil company
column4:
but couldn''t find any oil in Texas; company went bankrupt shortly after I sold all my stock.
Bought the Texas Rangers baseball team in a sweetheart deal that took land using taxpayer money. Biggest move: Traded Sammy Sosa to the Chicago White Sox.
With father''s help (and his name) was elected Governor of Texas.
Accomplishments in Previous Positions

Changed pollution laws for power and oil companies and made Texas the most polluted state in the Union.

Replaced Los Angeles with Houston as the most smog-ridden city in America. Cut taxes and bankrupted the Texas government to the tune of billions in borrowed money.

Set record for most executions by any governor in American history.

Became president after losing the popular vote by over 500
column5: 000 votes
column6:
with the help of my father''s appointments to the Supreme Court.

\n

Accomplishments As President

\n

Attacked and took over two countries.
Spent the surplus and bankrupted the treasury.
Shattered record for biggest annual deficit in history.
Set economic record for most private bankruptcies filed in any 12-month period.
Set all-time record for biggest drop in the history of the stock market.
First president in decades to execute a federal prisoner.
First president in U.S. history to enter office with a criminal record.
First year in office set the all-time record for most days on vacation by any president in U.S. history.
After taking the entire month of August off for vacation
column7:
presided over the worst security failure in U.S. history.
Set the record for most campaign fundraising trips than any other president in U.S. history.
In my first two years in office over 2 million Americans lost their job.
Cut unemployment benefits for more out of work Americans than any president in U.S. history.
Set the all-time record for most foreclosures in a 12-month period.
Appointed more convicted criminals to administration positions than any president in U.S. history.
Set the record for the least amount of press conferences than any president since the advent of television.
Signed more laws and executive orders amending the Constitution than any president in U.S. history.
Presided over the biggest energy crises in U.S. history and refused to intervene when corruption was revealed.
Presided over the highest gasoline prices in U.S. history and refused to use the national reserves as past presidents have.
Cut healthcare benefits for war veterans.
Set the all-time record for most people worldwide to simultaneously take to the streets to protest me (15 million people)
column8:
shattering the record for protest against any person in the history of mankind.
Dissolved more international treaties than any president in U.S. history.
My presidency is the most secretive and unaccountable of any in U.S. history.
Members of my cabinet are the richest of any administration in U.S. history (the ''poorest'' multimillionaire
column9: Condoleezza Rice
column10:
has an Exxon oil tanker named after her).
First president in U.S. history to have all 50 states of the Union simultaneously go bankrupt.
Presided over the biggest corporate stock market fraud of any market in any country in the history of the world.
First president in U.S. history to order a U.S. attack and military occupation of a sovereign nation.
Created the largest government department bureaucracy in the history of the United States.
Set the all-time record for biggest annual budget spending increases
column11:
more than any president in U.S. history.
First president in U.S. history to have the United Nations remove the U.S. from the human rights commission.
First president in U.S. history to have the United Nations remove the U.S. from the elections monitoring board.
Removed more checks and balances
column12:
and have the least amount of congressional oversight than any presidential administration in U.S. history.
Rendered the entire United Nations irrelevant.
Withdrew from the World Court of Law.
Refused to allow inspectors access to U.S. prisoners of war and by default no longer abide by the Geneva Conventions.
First president in U.S. history to refuse United Nations election inspectors (during the 2002 U.S. elections).
All-time U.S. (and world) record holder for most corporate campaign donations.
My biggest lifetime campaign contributor presided over one of the largest corporate bankruptcy frauds in world history (Kenneth Lay
column13:
former CEO of Enron Corporation).
Spent more money on polls and focus groups than any president in U.S. history.
First president in U.S. history to unilaterally attack a sovereign nation against the will of the United Nations and the world community.
First president to run and hide when the U.S. came under attack (and then lied saying the enemy had the code to Air Force 1)
First U.S. president to establish a secret shadow government.
Took the biggest world sympathy for the U.S. after 9/11
column14:
and in less than a year made the U.S. the most resented country in the world (possibly the biggest diplomatic failure in U.S. and world history).
With a policy of ''disengagement'' created the most hostile Israeli-Palestine relations in at least 30 years.
Fist U.S. president in history to have a majority of the people of Europe (71%) view my presidency as the biggest threat to world peace and stability.
First U.S. president in history to have the people of South Korea more threatened by the U.S. than their immediate neighbor
column15:
North Korea.
Changed US policy to allow convicted criminals to be awarded government contracts.
Set all-time record for number of administration appointees who violated U.S. law by not selling huge investments in corporations bidding for government contracts.
Failed to fulfill my pledge to get Osama Bin Laden ''dead or alive.''
Failed to capture the anthrax killer who tried to murder the leaders of our country at the United States Capital building. After 18 months I have no leads and zero suspects.
In the 18 months following the 9/11 attacks I have successfully prevented any public investigation into the biggest security failure in the history of the United States.
Removed more freedoms and civil liberties for Americans than any other president in U.S. history.
In a little over two years created the most divided country in decades
column16:
possibly the most divided the U.S. has ever been since the Civil War.
Entered office with the strongest economy in U.S. history and in less than two years turned every single economic category heading straight down.
Records and References

\n

At least one conviction for drunk driving in Maine (Texas driving record has been erased and is not available)
AWOL from National Guard and deserted the military during a time of war.
Refuse to take drug test or even answer any questions about drug use.
All records of my tenure as governor of Texas have been spirited away to my father''s library
column17:
sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public view.
All records of any SEC investigations into my insider trading or bankrupt companies are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public view.
All minutes of meetings for any public corporation I served on the board are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public view.
Any records or minutes from meetings I (or my VP) attended regarding public energy policy are sealed in secrecy and unavailable for public review.
For personal references please speak to my daddy or uncle James Baker (they can be reached at their offices of the Carlyle Group for war-profiteering.)

\n

Source: Kelley Kramer]

A child will not spill on a dirty floor.

nothing beats children.

column6:
just sit down and look comfortable.

Insanity is inherited; you get it from your kids.

It rarely occurs to teenagers that the day will come when they''ll know as little as their parents.

Money isn''t everything
column7:
but it sure keeps the kids in touch.

\n

Never lend your car to anyone to whom you have given birth. - actually from Erma Bombeck

One child is often not enough

but two children can be far too many.

Summer vacation is a time when parents realize that teachers are grossly underpaid.

The first sign of maturity is the discovery that the volume knob also turns to the left.

There are three ways to get things done: do it yourself
column9: hire someone to do it
column10:
or forbid your kids to do it.

\n

You can learn many things from children...like how much patience you have.]

column1: [The following is an exact transcription of a letter John Mongan received from MIT
column2: and the reply that he sent them. Unfortunately
column3: they chose to discontinue their correspondence at that point. I have heard
column4: however
column5:
that their recruitment letter has been revised and is far less snotty than it once was.
April 18
column6:
1994

\n

Mr. John T. Mongan 123 Main Street Smalltown
column7: California 9;;;;
column9:
Dear John:

You''ve got the grades. You''ve certainly got the PSAT scores. And now you''ve got a letter from MIT. Maybe you''re surprised. Most students would be.

But you''re not most students. And that''s exactly why I urge you to consider carefully one of the most selective universities in America.

The level of potential reflected in your performance is a powerful indicator that you might well be an excellent candidate for MIT. It certainly got my attention!

Engineering''s not for you? No problem. It may surprise you to learn we offer more than 40 major fields of study
column10: from architecture to brain and cognitive sciences
column11:
from economics (perhaps the best program in the country) to writing.

\n

What? Of course
column12: you don''t want to be bored. Who does? Life here is tough and demanding
column13:
but it''s also fun. MIT students are imaginative and creative - inside and outside the classroom.

\n

You''re interested in athletics? Great! MIT has more varsity teams - 39 - than almost any other university
column14:
and a tremendous intramural program so everybody can participate.

\n

You think we''re too expensive? Don''t be too sure. We''ve got surprises for you there
column15:
too.

\n

Why not send the enclosed Information Request to find out more about this unique institution? Why not do it right now?

\n

Sincerely
column16:
\n

Michael C. Benhke Director of Admissions

\n

P.S. If you''d like a copy of a fun-filled
column17: fact-filled brochure
column18: "Insight
column19:
just check the appropriate box on the form.

May 5, 1994

Michael C. Behnke MIT Director of Admissions Office of Admissions, Room 3-108 Cambridge MA 02139-;;;;,

Dear Michael:

You''ve got the reputation. You''ve certainly got the pomposity. And now you''ve got a letter from John Mongan. Maybe you''re surprised. Most universities would be.

But you''re not most universities. And that''s exactly why I urge you to carefully consider one of the most selective students in America, so selective that he will choose only one of the thousands of accredited universities in the country.

The level of pomposity and lack of tact reflected in your letter is a powerful indicator that your august institution might well be a possibility for John Mongan''s future education. It certainly got my attention!

Don''t want Bio-Chem students? No problem. It may surprise you to learn that my interests cover over 400 fields of study, from semantics to limnology, from object-oriented programming (perhaps one of the youngest professionals in the country) to classical piano.

What? Of course you don''t want egotistical jerks. Who does? I am self indulgent and over confident, but I''m also amusing. John Mongan is funny and amusing - whether you''re laughing with him or at him.

You''re interested in athletes? Great! John Mongan has played more sports - 47 - than almost any other student, including oddball favorites such as Orienteering.

You think I can pay for your school? Don''t be too sure. I''ve got surprises for you there, too.

Why not send a guaranteed admission and full scholarship to increase your chance of being selected by John Mongan? Why not do it right now?

Sincerely,

John Mongan

P.S. If you''d like a copy of a fun-filled, fact-filled brochure, John Mongan: What a Guy!" just ask.

John never got a reply.]

column3: however

column1: [1. Atlanta is comprised entirely of one way streets. The only way to get out of downtown Atlanta is to turn around and start over when you reach Greenville
column2:
South Carolina.

\n

2. All directions start with
column3:
"Go down Peachtree..."

\n

3. Peachtree Street has no beginning and no end.

\n

4. Atlanta is home of Coca Cola. That''s all we drink here
column4:
so don''t ask for any other soft drink.

5. Atlantans only know their way home and their way to work.

6. Gate One at the Airport is 32 miles away from the Main Concourse.

7. It''s impossible to go around a block and wind up on the street you started on. The Chamber of Commerce calls this a "scenic drive".

8. The 8 a.m. rush hour is from 6:30 to 9:30 a.m. The 5:00 p.m. rush hour is from 3:30 to 6:30 p.m. Friday''s rush hour starts Thursday morning.

9. Reversible Lanes are not understood by anybody.

10. "Sir" and "Ma''am" are used by the person speaking to you if there''s a remote possibility that you''re at least 30 minutes older than they are.

11. "Sugar" is a more common form of address than "Miss". So is "Honey".

12. Ponce de Leon Avenue can only be pronounced by a native
column5:
so do not attempt the Spanish pronunciation. People will simply tilt their heads to the right and stare at you.

\n

13. The falling of one rain drop causes all traffic to immediately cease; so will daylight savings time and a girl applying eye shadow across the street
column6:
or a flat tire three lanes over.

\n

14. If you''re standing on a corner and a MARTA Bus stops
column7:
you''re expected to get on and go somewhere.

\n

15. Atlanta is pronounced "Lan-uh".

\n

16. Construction on Peachtree Street is a way of life
column8:
and a permanent form of entertainment.

\n

17. Construction crews aren''t doing their job properly unless they close down all lanes except one during rush hour. (Ed. note: This appears to be a common theme in almost any major American city).

\n

18. Atlanta''s traffic is the friendliest around. The commuters spend hours mingling with each other twice a day. In fact
column9:
Atlanta''s traffic is rated number 1 in the country. You will often see people parked beside the road and engaged in lively discussions.

\n

19. Atlantans are very proud of their race track
column10: known as Road Atlanta. It winds throughout the city on the Interstates

hence its name.

20. Georgia 400 is the southern equivalent of the AutoBahn. You will rarely see a semi-truck on GA400
column12: because the truck drivers are intimidated by the oversized-SUV-wielding housewives racing home after a grueling day at the salon or the tennis match to meet their children at the school bus.]

column1:
["East Texas Driving Tips"

\n

- Dim your headlights for approaching vehicles
column2:
even if the gun
is loaded and the deer is in sight.
- When approaching a four-way stop
column3:
the vehicle with the largest
tires always gets the right of way.
- Never tow another car using pantyhose and duct tape.
- When sending your wife down the road with a gas can
column4:
it is
impolite to ask her to bring back beer.
- Never relieve yourself from a moving vehicle
column5:
especially when
driving.
- Do not remove the seats from the car so that all your kids can
fit in.
- Do not lay rubber while traveling in a funeral procession.

\n

"East Texas Personal Hygiene"

\n

- Unlike clothes and shoes
column6:
a toothbrush should never be a
hand-me-down item.
- If you have to vacuum the bed
column7:
it''s time to change the sheets.
- While ears need to be cleaned regularly
column8:
this is a job that
should be done in private using one''s OWN truck keys.
- Plucking unwanted nose hair is time-consuming work. A cigarette
lighter and a small tolerance for pain can accomplish the same
goal and save hours. Note: It''s a good idea to keep a bucket of
water handy when using this method.

\n

"East Texas Dating (outside the family)"

\n

- Always offer to bait your date''s hook
column9:
especially on the first
date.
- Be aggressive. Let her know you are interested: "I''ve been
wanting to go out with you since I read that stuff on the men''s
bathroom wall two years ago".

"East Texas Theater Etiquette"

- Crying babies should be taken to the lobby and picked up
immediately after the movie had ended.
- Refrain from talking to characters on the screen. Tests have
proven they can''t hear you.

"East Texas Wedding Etiquette"

- Livestock is usually a poor choice for a wedding gift.
- It''s not OK for the groom to bring a date to the wedding.
- A bridal veil made of window screen is not only cost effective
but also a proven fly deterrent.
- For the groom
column10:
at least rent a tux. A leisure suit with a
cummerbund and a clean bowling shirt can create a natty
appearance. Though uncomfortable
column11:
say yes to socks and shoes
for this special occasion.

\n

"East Texas Etiquette for All Occasions"

\n

- Never take a beer to a job interview or ask if they press
charges.
- Always identify people in your yard before shooting at them.
- Always say "Excuse me" after getting sick in someone''s else''s
car.
- It''s considered tacky to take a cooler to church
column12: - Even if you''re certain that you are included in the will
column13:
you
should refrain from driving a U-Haul to the funeral home.
- The socially refined never fish coins out of public toilets
column14:
especially if other people are around.
- Always provide an alibi to the police for family members.]

column3: however
column4: to spread paint on all four walls of a  20 by 20 foot room.- Baseballs make marks on ceilings.- You should not throw baseballs up when the ceiling fan is on.- When using the ceiling fan as a bat you have to throw the ball up a  few times before you get a hit.- A ceiling fan can hit a baseball a long way.- The glass in windows (even double pane) doesn''t stop a baseball hit  by a ceiling fan.- When you hear the toilet flush and the words Uh-oh
column5: it''s already too late.- Brake fluid mixed with Clorox makes smoke
column6: and lots of it.- A six year old can start a fire with a flint rock even though a 36  year old man says they can only do it in the movies.- A magnifying glass can start a fire even on an overcast day.- If you use a waterbed as home plate while wearing baseball shoes it  does not leak -- it explodes.- A king size waterbed holds enough water to fill a 2000 square foot  house 4 inches deep.- Legos will pass through the digestive tract of a four year old.- Duplos will not.- Play Dough and Microwave should never be used in the same sentence.- Super glue is forever.- McGyver can teach us many things we don''t want to know.- Ditto Tarzan.- No matter how much Jell-O you put in a swimming pool you still can''t  walk on water.- Pool filters do not like Jell-O.- VCR''s do not eject PB&J sandwiches even though TV commercials show  they do.- Garbage bags do not make good parachutes.- Marbles in gas tanks make lots of noise when driving.- You probably do not want to know what that odor is.- Always look in the oven before you turn it on.- Plastic toys do not like ovens.- The fire department in San Diego has at least a 5 minute response time.- The spin cycle on the washing machine does not make earth worms dizzy.- It will however make cats dizzy.- Cats throw up twice their body weight when dizzy.- Quiet does not necessarily mean don''t worry.- A good sense of humor will get you through most problems in life  (unfortunately

column1: [A Frenchman
column2: and Englishman
column3:
and a New Yorker were captured by cannibals.

\n

The chief of the cannibals comes to them and says "Guys
column4:
I have good news and bad news."

\n

"The bad news is that now that we''ve caught you
column5: we''re going to kill you. We will put you in a pot and cook you
column6: eat you
column7:
and then use your skins to build a canoe."

\n

"The good news is that you get to choose how you die."

\n

The Frenchman says
column8: in a very heavy french accent
column9:
"I take ze sword."

\n

When the chief gives him a sword the Frenchman takes it
column10: exclaims "Vive la France
column11:
and runs himself through.

\n

The Englishman is next. He looks the chief in the eye and says A pistol for me
column12:
please."

\n

The chief gives him the pistol. The Englishman cocks the gun
column13: points it at his head
column14:
yells "God save the queen!" and blows his brains out.

\n

The chief turns to the New Yorker. "Gimme a fork
column15:
the man says, with complete disdain.

The chief is puzzled, but he shrugs and gives the man a fork.

The New Yorker takes the fork and starts jabbing himself all over his body - the stomach, the sides, the chest, his arms, his legs, everywhere.

Blood is gushing out of what seems like every inch of his body. It is horrible.

The chief is appalled, and asks My God
column16:
what are you doing?"

\n

The New Yorker looks up at him from the ever expanding pool of blood and says "So much for your canoe
column17:
you stupid bastard!"

\n

Submitted by Curtis
Edited by Yisman]

column1: [Dear Dad & Mom
column2: Our scoutmaster told us all write to our parents in case you saw the flood on TV and worried. We are OK. Only 1 of our tents and 2 Sleeping bags got washed away. Luckily
column3: none of us got drowned because we we''re all up on the mountain looking for Chad when it happened.Oh yea! Please call Chad''s mother and tell her he is OK. He can''t write because of the cast. I got to ride in one of the search & rescue jeeps. It was neat. We never would have found him in the dark if it hadn''t been for the lightning. Scoutmaster Webb got mad at Chad for going on a hike alone without telling anyone. Chad said he did tell him
column4: but it was during the fire so he probably didn''t hear him.Did you know that if you put gas on a fire
column5: the gas can will blow up? The wet wood still didn''t burn
column6: but one of our tents did
column7: also some of our clothes. John is going to look weird until his hair grows back.We will be home on Saturday if Scoutmaster Webb gets the car fixed. It wasn''t his fault about the wreck. The brakes worked OK when we left. Scoutmaster Webb said that a car that old you have to expect something to break down; that''s probably why he can''t get insurance on it. We think it''s a neat car.He doesn''t care if we get it dirty
column8: and if it''s hot
column9: sometimes he lets us ride on the tailgate. It gets pretty hot with 10 people in a car. He let us take turns riding in the trailer until the highway patrolman stopped and talked to us.Scoutmaster Webb is a neat guy. Don''t worry
column10: he is a good driver. In fact
column11: he is teaching Terry how to drive. But he only lets him drive on the mountain roads where there isn''t any traffic. All we ever see up there are logging trucks.This morning all of the guys were diving off the rocks and swimming out in the lake. Scoutmaster Webb wouldn''t let me because I can''t swim and Chad was afraid he would sink because of his cast
column12: so he let us take the canoe across the lake. It was great. You can still see some of the trees under the water from the flood.Scoutmaster Webb isn''t crabby like some scoutmasters. He didn''t even get mad about us not wearing the life jackets.He has to spend a lot of time working on the car so we are trying not to cause him any trouble.Guess what? We have all passed our first aid merit badges. When Dave dove in the lake and cut his arm
column13: we got to see how a tourniquet works. Also Wade and I threw up. Scoutmaster Webb said it probably was just food poisoning from the leftover chicken
column14: he said they got sick that way with the food they ate in prison. I''m so glad he got out and become our scoutmaster. He said he sure figured out how to get things done better while he was doing his time.I have to go now. We are going into town to mail our letters and buy bullets. Don''t worry about anything. We are fine.Love
column15: Your son
column16: Cole-- Submitted by Angela Tuttle]

column1:
[Dear Mom and Dad:

\n

It has now been three months since I left for college.I have been remiss in
writing this and I am very sorry for my thoughtlessness in not having written
before. I will bring you up to date now
column2: but
column3: before you read on
column4:
please sit
down.
YOU ARE NOT TO READ ANY FURTHER UNLESS YOU ARE SITTING DOWN OKAY!
Well then
column5:
I am getting along pretty well now. The skull fracture and the
concussion I got when I jumped out of the window of my dormitory when it caught
fire shortly after my arrival are pretty well healed now. I only get those sick
headaches once a day.
Fortunately the fire in the dormitory and my jump were witnessed by an
attendant at the gas station near the dorm
column6:
and he was the one who called the
fire department and the ambulance.
He also visited me at the hospital and
column7:
since I had nowhere to live because of
the burned out dormitory
column8:
he was kind enough to invite me to share his apartment
with him. It''s really a basement room
column9:
but it''s kind of cute. He is a very fine
boy and we have fallen deeply in love and are planning to be married.
We haven''t set the exact date yet
column10:
but it will be before my pregnancy
begins to show.
Yes
column11: Mom and Dad
column12:
I am pregnant. I know how much you are looking forward to
being grandparents and I know you will welcome the baby and give it the love
column13:
devotion and tender care you gave me when I was a child.
The reason for the delay in our marriage is that my boyfriend has some minor
infection which prevents us from passing our pre-marital blood tests
column14:
and I
carelessly caught it from him. This will soon clear up with the penicillin
injections I am having daily. I know you will welcome him into our family with
open arms. He is kind and
column15: although not well educated
column16:
he is ambitious.
Although he is of a different race and religion than ours
column17:
I know your
often expressed tolerance will not permit you to be bothered by the fact that
his skin colour is somewhat darker than ours. I am sure you will love him as I
do. His family background is good too
column18:
for I am told that his father is an
important gun-bearer in the village in Africa from which he came.

\n

Now that I have brought you up to date
column19:
I want to tell you that there was no
dormitory fire
column20:
I did not have a concussion or a skull fracture. I was not in
the hospital
column21: I am not pregnant
column22:
I am not engaged. I do not have syphilis and
there is no man (of any colour) in my life. However
column23:
I am getting a ''D'' in
History and an ''F'' in Science and I wanted you to see those marks in the proper
perspective.

\n

Yours
column24: Your Loving Daughter.]

column1:
[DINING OUT

\n

1. When decanting wine
column2: make sure that you tilt the paper cup
column3:
and pour slowly so as not to "bruise" the fruit of the vine.

\n

2. If drinking directly from the bottle
column4:
always hold it with your fingers covering the label.

ENTERTAINING IN YOUR HOME

1. A centerpiece for the table should never be anything prepared by a taxidermist.

2. Do not allow the dog to eat at the table...no matter how good his manners are.

PERSONAL HYGIENE

1. While ears need to be cleaned regularly
column5:
this is a job that should be done in private using one''s OWN truck keys.

\n

2. Proper use of toiletries can forestall bathing for several days. However
column6: if you live alone
column7:
deodorant is a waste of good money.

\n

3. Dirt and grease under the fingernails is a social no-no
column8:
as they tend to detract from a woman''s jewelry and alter the taste of finger foods.

\n

DATING (Outside the Family)

\n

1. Always offer to bait your date''s hook
column9:
especially on the first date.

\n

2. Be aggressive. Let her know you''re interested: "I''ve been wanting to go out with you since I read that stuff on the bathroom wall two years ago."

\n

3. Establish with her parents what time she is expected back. Some will say 10:00 PM; Others might say "Monday." If the latter is the answer
column10:
it is the man''s responsibility to get her to school on time.

THEATER ETIQUETTE

1. Crying babies should be taken to the lobby and picked up immediately after the movie has ended.

2. Refrain from talking to characters on the screen. Tests have proven they can''t hear you.

WEDDINGS

1. Livestock
column11: usually
column12:
is a poor choice for a wedding gift.

\n

2. Kissing the bride for more than 5 seconds may get you shot.

\n

3. For the groom
column13: at least
column14:
rent a tux. A leisure suit with a cummerbund and a clean bowling shirt can create a tacky appearance.

\n

4. Though uncomfortable
column15:
say "yes" to socks and shoes for this special occasion.

\n

DRIVING ETIQUETTE

\n

1. Dim your headlights for approaching vehicles; Even if the gun is loaded
column16:
and the deer is in sight.

\n

2. When approaching a four-way stop
column17:
the vehicle with the largest tires always has the right of way.

\n

3. Never tow another car using panty hose and duct tape.

\n

4. When sending your wife down the road with a gas can
column18:
it is impolite to ask her to bring back beer.

\n

5. Never relieve yourself from a moving vehicle
column19:
especially when driving.

\n

6. Do not lay rubber while traveling in a funeral procession.]

column1: [The animals were bored. Finally
column2:
the lion had an idea. "I know a really exciting game that the humans play called football. I''ve seen it on T.V."

\n

He proceeded to describe it to the rest of the animals and they all got excited about it so they decided to play. They went out to the field and chose up teams and were ready to begin.

\n

The lion''s team received. They were able to get two first downs and then had to punt. The mule punted and the rhino was back deep for the kick. He caught the ball
column3: lowered his head and charged. First
column4: he crushed a roadrunner
column5: then two rabbits. He gored a wildebeast
column6: knocked over two cows
column7: and broke through to daylight
column8:
scoring six.

\n

Unfortunately
column9: they lacked a placekicker
column10:
and the score remained 6 - 0.

\n

Late in the first half the lion''s team scored a touchdown and the mule kicked the extra point. The lion''s team led at halftime 7 - 6. In the locker room
column11:
the lion gave a peptalk.

\n

"Look you guys. We can win this game. We''ve got the lead and they only have one real threat. We''ve got to keep the ball away from the rhino
column12: he''s a killer. Mule
column13:
when you kick off be sure to keep it away from the rhino."

\n

The second half began. Just as the mule was about to kick off
column14: the rhino''s team changed formation and the ball went directly to the rhino. Once again
column15: the rhino lowered his head and was off running. First
column16: he stomped two gazelles. He skewered a zebra
column17: and bulldozed an elephant out of the way. It looked like he was home free. Suddenly at the twenty yard line
column18:
he dropped over dead. There were no other animals in sight anywhere near him. The lion went over to see what had happened. Right next to the dead rhino he saw a small centipede.

\n

"Did you do this?" he asked the centipede.

\n

"Yeah
column19:
I did." the centipede replied.

\n

The lion retorted
column20:
"Where were you during the first half?"

\n

"I was putting on my shoes."]

column1: [There''s a story about an MIT student who spent an entire summer going to the Harvard football field every day wearing a black and white striped shirt

column4: it came time for the first Harvard home football team
column5: the referee walked onto the field and blew the whistle
column6:
and the game had to be delayed for a half hour to wait for the birds to get off of the field.

\n

The guy wrote his thesis on this
column7: and graduated.]

[Two cowboys from Arkansas walk into a roadhouse to wash the trail dust from their throats.

\n

They stand at the bar
column2:
drinking their beers and talking quietly about cattle prices.

Suddenly a woman at a table behind them who had been eating a sandwich begins to cough. After a minute or so it becomes apparent that she is in real distress.

The cowboys turn to look at her.

"Kin yah swallow? asked one of the cowboys.

The woman shakes her head "No".

"Kin yah breathe?" asks the other cowboy.

The woman
column3: beginning to turn blue
column4:
shakes her head "NO" again.

\n

The first cowboy walks over to her
column5:
lifts up the back of her skirt and slowly runs his tongue from the back of her thigh up to the small of her back.

\n

This sends the woman into a violent spasm
column6: the obstruction flies out of her mouth
column7:
and she begins to breathe again.

\n

The cowboy walks back over to the bar and takes a drink of his beer. His partner says
column8: "Ya know
column9: I''d heard of that there Hind Lick Maneuver
column10: but I ain''t never seen nobody do it."]

[1. Watch the sunset-- on a sled.

column2:
--it might get you a free beer.

6. Count your blessings. -- You might need these too!

column3:
or those carrying beer.

column8:
naked.

treat yourself to an ice cream cone. -- OK I WILL! Then a beer.

column12:
try to hear. --Then try to listen to a friend.
38. Wear shoes until they''re so old they won''t stay on your feet. --Then wear them swimming.
39. Appreciate the primary colors. -- Know them!

column13:

column14:

column16:
and recycle it.

column17:
on an Arctic Cat.
50. Never lose your sense of humor. -- You will need it!]

column1:
[1 star hangover

No pain. no real feeling of illness. You slept in your own bed and when
you woke up there were no traffic cones in there with you.

You are still able to function relatively well on the energy stored up
from all those vodka redbulls.

However
column2:
you can drink 10 bottles of water and still feel as parched as
the Sahara.

Even vegetarians are craving a Cheeseburger and a bag of fries.

2 star hangover

No pain
column3:
but something is definitely amiss. You may look okay but you
have the attention span and mental capacity of a stapler.

\n

The coffee you hug to try and remain focused is only exacerbating your
rumbling gut
column4:
which is craving a full English breakfast.

\n

Although you have a nice demeanour about the office
column5:
you are costing
your employer valuable money because all you really can handle is some
light filing
column6:
followed by aimlessly surfing the net and writing junk
e-mails.

3 star hangover

Slight headache. stomach feels crap. You are definitely a space cadet
and not so productive.

Anytime a girl or lad walks by you gag because the perfume/aftershave
reminds you of the random gin shots you did with your alcoholic friends
after the bouncer kicked you out at 1:45 am.

Life would be better right now if you were in your bed with a dozen
doughnuts and a litre of coke watching daytime TV.

You''ve had 4 cups of coffee
column7: a gallon of water
column8:
2 Sausage Rolls and a
litre of diet coke yet you haven''t peed once.

4 star hangover

You have lost the will to live. Your head is throbbing and you can''t
speak too quickly or else you might spew.

Your boss has already lambasted you for being late and has given you a
lecture for reeking of booze.

You wore nice clothes
column9: but you smell of socks
column10:
and you can''t hide the
fact that you either missed an oh-so crucial spot shaving or it looks
like you put your make-up on while riding the dodgems (depending on your
gender).

\n

Your teeth have their own individual sweaters. Your eyes look like one
big vein and your hairstyle makes you look like a reject from a
second-grade class circa 1976.

\n

You would give a weeks pay for one of the following - home time
column11:
a
doughnut and somewhere to be alone
column12:
or a Time Machine so you could go
back and NOT have gone out the night before.

You scare small children in the street just by walking past them.

5 star hangover

You have a second heartbeat in your head
column13:
which is actually annoying the
employee who sits next to you.

Vodka vapour is seeping out of every pore and making you dizzy.

You still have toothpaste crust in the corners of your mouth from
brushing your teeth.

Your body has lost the ability to generate saliva
column14:
so your tongue is
suffocating you.

You''d cry but that would take the last drop of moisture left in your
body.

Death seems pretty good right now. Your boss doesn''t even get mad at you
and your co-workers think that your dog just died because you look so
pathetic.

You should have called in sick because
column15: let''s face it
column16:
all you can
manage to do is breathe ..... very gently.

6 star hangover

You arrive home and climb into bed.

Sleep comes instantly
column17:
as you were fighting it all the way home in the
taxi.

You get about 2 hours sleep until the noises inside your head wake you
up.

You notice that your bed has been cleared for take off and is flying
relentlessly around the room.

No matter what you do you now
column18:
you''re going to chuck.

\n

You stumble out of bed and now find that your room is in a yacht under
full sail.

\n

After walking along the skirting boards on alternating walls knocking
off all the pictures
column19:
you find the toilet.

\n

If you are lucky you will remember to lift the lid before you
spontaneously explode and wake the whole house up with your
impersonation of walrus mating calls.

\n

You sit there on the floor in your undies
column20:
cuddling the only friend in
the world you have left (the toilet)
column21:
randomly continuing to make the
walrus noises
column22: spitting
column23: and farting. Help usually comes at this stage
column24:
even if it is short lived.

\n

Tears stream down your face and your abdomen hurts. Help now turns into
abuse and he/she usually goes back to bed leaving you there in the dark.

\n

With your stomach totally empty
column25:
your spontaneous eruptions have died
back to 15-minute intervals
column26:
but your body won''t relent.

You are convinced that you are starting to turn yourself inside out and swear that you saw your tonsils shoot out of your mouth on the last
occasion.

It is now dawn and you pass your disgusted partner getting up for the
day as you try to climb into bed. She/he abuses you again for trying to
get into bed with lumpy bits of dried vomit in your hair.

You reluctantly accept their advice and have a shower in exchange for
them driving you to the hospital.

Work is not an option.

The whole day is spent trying to avoid anything that might make you sick again
column27:
like moving.

\n

You vow never to touch a drop again and who knows for the next two or
three hours at least you might even succeed!!!]

Food consumed from someone else''s plate has no fat as it rightfully belongs to the other person and will cling to his/her plate. (Oh

column8: R10W
column9: Sec.  20
column10: Montcalm CountyIt has come to the attention of the Department of Environmental Quality that there has been recent unauthorized activity on the above referenced parcel of property.  You have been certified as the legal landowner and/or contractor who did the following unauthorized activity: Construction and maintenance of two wood debris dams across the outlet stream of Spring Pond.  A permit must be issued prior to the start of this type of activity.  A review of the Department''s files show that no permits have been issued.Therefore
column11: the Department has determined that this activity is in violation of Part 301
column12: .  Inland Lakes and Streams
column13: of the Natural Resource and Environmental Protection Act
column14: Act 451 of the Public Acts of 1994
column15: being sections 324.30101 to 324.30113 of the Michigan Compiled Laws annotated.  The Department has been informed that one or both of the dams partially
column16: failed during a recent rain event
column17: causing debris dams and flooding at downstream locations.  We find that dams of this nature are inherently hazardous and cannot be permitted.  The Department therefore orders you to cease and desist all unauthorized activities at this location
column18: and to restore the stream to a free-flow condition by removing all wood and brush forming the dams from the strewn channel. All restoration work shall be completed no later than January 31
column19: 1998. Please notify this office when the restoration has been completed so that a follow-up site inspection may be scheduled by our staff.Failure to comply with this request
column20: or any further unauthorized activity on the site
column21: may result in this case being referred for elevated enforcement action.  We anticipate and would appreciate your full cooperation in this matter.Please feel free to contact me at this office if you have any questions.Sincerely
column22: David L. Price District Representative Land and Water Management Division        ----Reply Letter----Dear Mr. Price:Re: DEQ File No.  97-59-0023;  T11N
column23: R10W
column24: Sec 20; Montcalm CountyYour certified letter dated 12/17/97 has been handed to me to respond to.  You sent out a great deal of carbon copies to a lot of people
column25: but you neglected to include their addresses.  You will
column26: therefore
column27: have to send them a copy of my response.First of all
column28: Mr. Ryan DeVries is not the legal landowner and/or contractor at 2088 Dagget
column29: Pierson
column30: Michigan - I am the legal owner and a couple of beavers are in the (State unauthorized) process of constructing and maintaining two wood ''debris'' dams across the outlet stream of my Spring Pond.  While I did not pay for
column31: nor authorize their dam project
column32: I think they would be highly offended you call their skillful use of natural building materials ''debris.''  I would like to challenge you to attempt to emulate their dam project any dam time and/or any dam place you choose.  I believe I can safely state there is no dam way you could ever match their dam skills
column33: their dam resourcefulness
column34: their dam ingenuity
column35: their dam persistence
column36: their dam determination and/or their dam work ethic.As to your dam request the beavers first must fill out a dam permit prior to the start of this type of dam activity
column37: my first dam question to you is: are you trying to discriminate against my Spring Pond Beavers or do you require all dam beavers throughout this State to conform to said dam request?  If you are not discriminating against these particular beavers
column38: please send me completed copies of all those other applicable beaver dam permits.  Perhaps we will see if there really is a dam violation of Part 301
column39: Inland Lakes and Streams

column41: Act 451 of the Public Acts of 1994
column42: being sections 324.30101 to 324.30113 of the Michigan Compiled Laws annotated.My first concern is - aren''t the dam beavers entitled to dam legal representation?The Spring Pond Beavers are financially destitute and are unable to pay for said dam representation - so the State will have to provide them with a dam lawyer.  The Department''s dam concern that either one or both of the dams failed during a recent rain event causing dam flooding is proof we should leave the dam Spring Pond Beavers alone rather than harassing them and calling their dam names.  If you want the dam stream ''restored'' to a dam free-flow condition - contact the dam beavers - but if you are going to arrest them (they obviously did not pay any dam attention to your dam letter-being unable to read English) - be sure you read them their dam Miranda rights first.  As for me
column43: I am not going to cause more dam flooding or dam debris jams by interfering with these dam builders.  If you want to hurt these dam beavers - be aware I am sending a copy of your dam letter and this response to PETA. If your dam Department seriously finds all dams of this nature inherently hazardous and truly will not permit their existence in this dam State - I seriously hope you are not selectively enforcing this dam policy - or once again both I and the Spring Pond Beavers will scream prejudice!In my humble opinion
column44: the Spring Pond Beavers have a right to build their dam unauthorized dams as long as the sky is blue
column45: the grass is green and water flows downstream.  They have more dam right than I to live and enjoy Spring Pond.  So
column46: as far as I and the beavers are concerned
column47: this dam case can be referred for more dam elevated enforcement action now.  Why wait until 1/31/98?  The Spring Pond Beavers may be under the dam ice then
column48: and there will be no dam way for you or your dam staff to contact/harass them then.In conclusion

column50: watch your step!  (The bears are not careful where they dump!)Being unable to comply with your dam request

[The Ferrari F1 Team recently fired the whole Pit-Crew to employ some young unemployed youths from Liverpool.

The decision to hire them was made after Ferrari F1 team boss Ross Brawn saw a BBC documentary on how unemployed youths in the Liverpool area can remove a set of car wheels in less than 4 sec without proper equipment.

This was thought to be a good move as most races are won & lost in the pits these days & Ferrari would have an advantage.

However Ferrari soon encountered a major problem: Not only were the lads changing the tyres in under 4 seconds but within 10 seconds they had resprayed & re-numbered the car
column2: and sold it to the McLaren team.]

Our Cash

[A man had 50 yard line tickets for the Super Bowl.

\n

As he sits down
column2:
a man comes down and asks if anyone is sitting in the seat next to him.

\n

"No
column3:
he says, The seat is empty."

\n

"This is incredible
column4:
said the man.

\n

Who in their right mind would have a seat like this for the Super Bowl
column5: the biggest sporting event in the world
column6:
and not use it?"

\n

He says
column7: "Well
column8: actually
column9: the seat belongs to me. I was supposed to come with my wife
column10:
but she passed away. This is the first Super bowl we haven''t been to

\n

together since we got married in 1967."

\n

"Oh
column11: I''m sorry to hear that.  That''s terrible.  But couldn''t you find someone else -- a friend or relative
column12:
or even a neighbor to take the seat?"

\n

The man shakes his head.

\n

"No
column13:
they''re all at the funeral."

column1:
[1. Men like to barbecue. Men will cook if danger is involved.

\n

2. Men who have pierced ears are better prepared for marriage. They''ve experienced pain and bought jewelry.

\n

3. Marrying a divorced man is ecologically responsible. In a world where there are more women than men
column2:
it pays to recycle.

\n

4. Men are very confident people. My husband is so confident that when he watches sports on television
column3: he thinks that if he concentrates he can help his team. If the team is in trouble
column4: he coaches the players from our living room
column5: and if they''re really in trouble
column6:
I have to get off the phone in case they call him.

5. Men like phones with lots of buttons. It makes them feel important.

6. Men love to be the first to read the newspaper in the morning. Not being the first is upsetting to their psyches.

7. All men are afraid of eyelash curlers. I sleep with one under my pillow
column7:
instead of a gun.

\n

8. A good place to meet a man is at the dry cleaner. These men usually have jobs and bathe.

\n

9. All men hate to hear
column8:
"We need to talk about our relationship." These seven words strike fear in the heart of even General Schwarzkopf.

\n

10. Men are sensitive in strange ways. If a man has built a fire and the last log does not burn
column9:
he will take it personally.

\n

11. Men have an easier time buying bathing suits. Women have two types: depressing and more depressing. Men have two types: nerdy and not nerdy.

\n

12. Men have higher body temperatures than women. If your heating goes out in winter
column10:
I recommend sleeping next to a man. Men are like portable heaters that snore.

\n

13. Women take clothing much more seriously than men. I''ve never seen a man walk into a party and say "Oh
column11: my God
column12:
I''m so embarrassed; get me out of here. There''s another man wearing a black tuxedo."

\n

14. Most men hate to shop. That''s why the men''s department is usually on the first floor of a department store
column13:
two inches from the door.

\n

15. If a man prepares dinner for you and the salad contains three or more types of lettuce
column14:
you should be worried about him.

\n

16. No man is charming all of the time. Even Cary Grant is on record saying he wished he could be Cary Grant.

\n

17. When four or more men get together
column15:
they talk about sports.

\n

18. When four or more women get together
column16:
they talk about men.

\n

19. Men are less sentimental than women. No man has ever seen the movie "The Way We Were" twice
column17:
voluntarily.

\n

20. Most women are introspective: "Am I in love? Am I emotionally and creatively fulfilled?" Most men are outrospective: "Did my team win? How''s my car?"

\n

21. If a man says
column18: "I''ll call you
column19:
and he doesn''t, he didn''t forget. He didn''t lose your number. He didn''t die. He just didn''t want to call you.

\n

22. Getting rid of a man without hurting his masculinity is a problem. Get out" and "I never want to see you again" might sound like a challenge. If you want to get rid of a man
column20: I suggest saying
column21: "I love you; I want to marry you; I want to have your children." Sometimes they leave so fast
column22:
they leave skid marks.

\n

23. Men are self confident because they grow up identifying with super heroes. Women have bad self images because they grow up identifying with Barbie.

\n

24. Male menopause is a lot more fun than female menopause. With female menopause you gain weight and get hot flashes. With male menopause
column23:
you get to date young girls and drive motorcycles.

\n

25. Men forget everything; women remember everything. That''s why men need instant replays in sports. They''ve already forgotten what happened.

\n

Submitted by Calamjo
Edited by Curtis]

column1: [Billy''s Mom''s LettersThe following appeared in a computer magazine in Mr. Dvorak''s column:Dear Mr. Dvorak:Ann Landers wouldn''t print this.  I have nowhere else to turn.  I have to get the word out. Warn other parents.  I must be rambling on. Let me try and explain.  It''s about my son
column2: Billy.  He''s always been a good
column3: normal ten year old boy.  Well
column4: last spring we sat down after dinner to select a summer camp for Billy.  We sorted through the camp brochures.  There were the usual camps with swimming
column5: canoeing
column6: games
column7: singing by the campfire -- you know. There were sports camps and specialty camps for weight reduction
column8: music
column9: military camps and camps that specialized in Tibetan knot tying.  I tried to talk him into Camp Winnepoopoo.  It''s where he went last year. (He made an adorable picture out of painted pinto beans and macaroni).  Billy would have none of it. Billy pulled a brochure out of his pocket.  It was for a COMPUTER CAMP! We should have put our foot down right there
column10: if only we had known.  He left three weeks ago.  I don''t know what''s happened.  He''s changed.  I can''t explain it. See for yourself. These are some of my little Billy''s letters.Dear Mom
column11: The kids are dorky nerds.  The food stinks.  The computers are the only good part.  We''re learning how to program.  Late at night is the best time to program
column12: so they let us stay up.                  Love
column13: Billy.Dear Mom
column14: Camp is O.K.  Last night we had pizza in the middle of the night.    We all get to choose what we want to drink.  I drink Classic Coke. By the way
column15: can you make Szechuan food?  I''m getting used to it now. Gotta go
column16: it''s time for the flowchart class.                  Love
column17: Billy.P.S. This is written on a wordprocessor. Pretty swell
column18: huh? It''s spellchecked too.Dear Mom
column19: Don''t worry.  We do regular camp stuff. We told ghost stories by the glow of the green computer screens.  It was real neat.  I don''t have much of a tan ''cause we don''t go outside very often.  You can''t see the computer screen in the sunlight anyway.  That wimp camp I went to last year fed us weird food too. Lay off
column20: Mom. I''m okay
column21: really.                   Love
column22: Billy.Dear Mom
column23: I''m fine. I''m sleeping enough. I''m eating enough.  This is the best camp ever.  We scared the counselor with some phony worm code.  It was real funny.  He got mad and yelled.  Frederick says it''s okay. Can you send more money? I spent mine on a pocket protector and a box of blankdiskettes. I''ve got to chip in on the phone bill.  Did you know that you can talk to people on a computer?  Give my regards to Dad.                   Love
column24: Billy.Dear Mother
column25: Forget the money for the telephone.  We''ve got a way to not pay. Sorry I haven''t written. I''ve been learning a lot. I''m real good at getting onto any computer in the country.  It''s really easy! I got into the university''s in less than fifteen minutes.  Frederick did it in five
column26: he''s going to show me how. Frederick is my bunk partner.  He''s really smart.  He says that I shouldn''t call myself Billy anymore.  So
column27: I''m not.                   Signed
column28: William.Dear Mother
column29: How nice of you to come up on Parents Day.  Why''d you get so upset?    I haven''t gained that much weight.  The glasses aren''t real. Everybody wears them. I was trying to fit in.  Believe me
column30: the tape on them is cool.  I thought that you''d be proud of my program. After all
column31: I''ve made some money on it.  A publisher is sending a check for $30
column32: 000.Anyway
column33: I''ve paid for the next six weeks of camp.  I won''t be home until late August.                   Regards
column34: William.Mother
column35: Stop treating me like a child.  True -- physically I am only ten years old. It was silly of you to try to kidnap me.  Do not try again. Remember
column36: I can make your life miserable (i.e. - the bank
column37: credit bureau
column38: and government computers). I am not kidding.  O.K.?  I won''t write again and this is your only warning. The emotions of this interpersonal communication drain me.                   Sincerely
column39: William.    See what I mean? It''s been two weeks since I''ve heard from my little boy. What can I do
column40: Mr.Dvorak?  I know that it''s probably too late to save my little Billy.  But
column41: if by printing these letters you can save JUST ONE CHILD from a life of programming
column42: please
column43: I beg of you to doso. Thank you very much. Sally Gates
column44: Concerned Parent]

do it!" The aide hustles the young man off.

the man asks. "Ribbit 3 wood." was the reply.

column10:

column21:

column1: [In order to brighten up the living room we bought a pet fish and an aquarium to put it in. The fish was brightly coloured and I often liked to watch it as it swam contentedly round and round its little rectangular tank of water. It was so friendly and tame that it was happy to take food directly out of my hand. Having an interest in the theories of Charles Darwin
column2: as an experiment one day I decided to see how the fish would adapt to change. So each day I would remove a tablespoonful of the water and replace it with a tablespoonful of seawater. This went on for several months until eventually the fish was happily swimming around in pure seawater.I decided to reverse the process
column3: and each day
column4: I would remove a tablespoonful of seawater from the tank and replaced it with a tablespoonful of fresh water until the water in the tank was completely returned to fresh water. The fish was none the worse for his experience.Encouraged by this success I decided to try a further experiment. Each day I would remove a tablespoonful of the water from the tank to see if the fish could adapt to the changed circumstances of reduced water levels. Although the fish had difficulty adapting at first it was eventually able to lie on the bed of the tank and breath air. Later I decided to move the fish to a disused budgerigar cage and was surprised to see that the fish had adapted to its new circumstances and was cheerfully hopping from perch to perch
column5: ringing the bell
column6: and playing on the swing. The fish lived like this for several months until sadly one day it fell from its perch straight into the bowl of drinking water and drowned.]

Next
column10: they went out in the back yard to survey the championship-style golf course that the home was located on. They would have golfing privileges every day and each week
column11:
the course changed to a new one representing the great golf courses on earth.

\n

The old man asked
column12:
"What are the green fees?"

\n

St. Peter replied
column13: "This is Heaven
column14:
you play for free."

\n

Next
column15:
they went to the club house and saw the lavish buffet lunch with the cuisine''s of the World laid out.

\n

"How much to eat?" asked the old man.

\n

"Don''t you understand yet? This is Heaven
column16: it is free!" St. Peter replied
column17: with some exasperation. "Well
column18:
where are the low fat and low cholesterol tables?" the old man asked timidly.

\n

St. Peter lectured
column19:
"That''s the best part - you can eat as much as you like of whatever you like and you never get fat and you never get sick. This is Heaven."

\n

With that
column20: the old man went into a fit of anger
column21: throwing down his hat and stomping on it
column22:
and screaming wildly.

\n

St. Peter and his wife both tried to calm him down
column23:
asking him what was wrong.

\n

The old man looked at his wife and said
column24: "This is all your fault! If it weren''t for your blasted bran muffins
column25:
I could have been here ten years ago!"

\n

Submitted by Glaci
Edited by Yisman]

column1:

column2:
when the Ants gained possession.

The elephant trod on the little ant
column3:
killing him instantly.

call that sportsmanship
column4:
killing another player?"

column6:
I didn''t mean to kill him -- I was just trying to
trip him up."]

column1: [When using a public campground
column2: a tuba placed on your picnic table will keep the campsites on either side vacant.Get even with a bear who raided your food bag by kicking his favorite stump apart and eating all the ants.A hot rock placed in your sleeping bag will keep your feet warm. A hot enchilada works almost as well
column3: but the cheese sticks between your toes.The best backpacks are named for national parks or mountain ranges. Steer clear of those named for landfills.While the Swiss Army Knife has been popular for years
column4: the Swiss Navy Knife has remained largely unheralded. Its single blade functions as a tiny canoe paddle.Modern rain suits made of fabrics that "breathe" enable campers to stay dry in a downpour. Rain suits that sneeze
column5: cough
column6: and belch
column7: however
column8: have been proven to add absolutely nothing to the wilderness experience.Lint from your navel makes a handy fire starter. Warning: Remove lint from navel before applying the match.You''ll never be lost if you remember that moss always grows on the north side of your compass.You can duplicate the warmth of a down-filled bedroll by climbing into a plastic garbage bag with several geese.The canoe paddle
column9: a simple device used to propel a boat
column10: should never be confused with a gnu paddle
column11: a similar device used by Tibetan veterinarians.When camping
column12: always wear a long-sleeved shirt. It gives you something to wipe your nose on.Take this simple test to see if you qualify for solo camping: Shine a flashlight into one ear. If the beam shines out the other ear
column13: do not go into the woods alone.A two-man pup tent does not include two men or a pup.A potato baked in the coals for one hour makes an excellent side dish. A potato baked in the coals for three hours makes an excellent hockey puck.In emergency situations
column14: you can survive in the wilderness by shooting small game with a slingshot made from the elastic waistband of your underwear.The guitar of the noisy teenager at the next campsite makes excellent kindling.The sight of a bald eagle has thrilled campers for generations. The sight of a bald man
column15: however
column16: does absolutely nothing for the eagle.It''s entirely possible to spend your whole vacation on a winding mountain road behind a large motor home.Bear bells provide an element of safety for hikers in grizzly country. The tricky part is getting them on the bears.]

column1:
[Two guys were working at a sawmill one day when one of the guys got too close
to the blade and cut off his arm. His buddy put the severed arm in a plastic bag
and rushed it down to the hospital to get re-attached. The next day he goes to
see his chum
column2:
and finds him playing tennis.
"Incredible!
column3:
says his friend. Medical science is amazing."
Another month goes by and the same two guys are again at the sawmill working
when the same guy gets too close to the spinning blade and this time his leg
gets cut off. Again his buddy takes the leg
column4:
puts it in a plastic bag and takes
it to the hospital to get re-attached. The next day
column5:
he goes down to see his
chum and finds him outside playing football.
"Incredible!
column6:
says his friend. Medical science is amazing!"
Well another month goes by and again the same two friends are at the mill
cutting wood when suddenly the same guy bends down too close to the blade and
off comes his head. Well his friend takes the head
column7: puts it in a plastic bag
column8:
and heads to the hospital to get it re-attached. The next day he goes to see his
friend but can''t find him. He sees the doctor walking down the hall and says
column9: "Doc
column10:
where is my friend? I brought him in yesterday."
The doctor thinks for a minute and says
column11: "Oh yeah
column12:
some idiot put his head in
a plastic bag and he suffocated."]

Not too bright.

too.

Still one step ahead of the cops.

Opinionated.

Offers plausible excuses for mistakes.

Won''t make a decision.

Buys drinks for all the boys in the office at happy hour.

Argumentative.

Obnoxious.

Gets someone else to do it.

Scared.

A nit picker.

Is tall or has a loud voice.

Lucky.

Knows a lot of dirty jokes.

Stubborn.

Back Stabber.

Gets to work on time.

Sleeps at desk.

Screws up often.

WORK IS FIRST PRIORITY:

Too ugly to get a date.

INDEPENDENT WORKER:

Nobody knows what he/she does all day.

Procrastinator.

Able to BS well.

GOOD COMMUNICATION SKILLS:

Spends lots of time on phone.

LOYAL:

Can''t get a job anywhere else.]

[After Christmas break
column2:
a teacher asked her young pupils to write an essay about how they spent their holidays. One small boy wrote the following:

\n

We always used to spend Christmas with Grandpa and Grandma. They used to live here in a big brick home
column3: but Grandpa got retarded and they moved to Florida. Now they live in a place with a lot of other retarded people. They all live in little tin boxes. They ride on three-wheeled tricycles and they all wear name tags
column4:
because they don''t know who they are.

\n

They go to a big building called a wrecked hall
column5: but if it was wrecked
column6: they got it fixed because it is alright now. They play games and do exercises there
column7:
but they don''t do them very good. There is a swimming pool there. They go in it and just stand there with their hats on. I guess they don''t know how to swim.

\n

As you go into their park
column8:
there is a doll house with a little man sitting in it. He watches all day so they can''t get out without him seeing them. When they can sneak out they go to the beach and pick up shells that they think are dollars.

\n

My grandma used to bake cookies and stuff
column9: but I guess she forgot how. Nobody cooks
column10: they just eat out. They eat the same thing every night - early birds. Some of the people are so retarded they don''t know how to cook at all
column11:
so my Grandma and Grandpa bring food into the wrecked hall and they call it "Pot Luck".

\n

My Grandma says Grandpa worked all his life and earned his retardment. I wish they would move back up here
column12: but I guess the little man in the doll house won''t let them out.]

column1:
[- Redneck Driving Etiquette -
Dim your headlights for approaching vehicles
column2:
even if the gun is loaded and the deer is in sight.
When approaching a four-way stop
column3:
the vehicle with the largest tires always has the right of way.
Never tow another car using pantyhose and duct tape.
When sending your wife down the road with a gas can
column4:
it is impolite to ask her to bring back beer.
Never relieve yourself from a moving vehicle
column5:
especially when driving.
Do not remove the seats from the car so that all your kids can fit in.
Do not lay rubber while traveling in a funeral procession.

\n

- Redneck Personal Hygiene -
Unlike clothes and shoes
column6:
a toothbrush should never be a hand-me-down item.
If you have to vacuum the bed
column7:
it''s time to change the sheets.
While ears need to be cleaned regularly
column8:
this is a job that should be done in private using one''s OWN truck keys.
Plucking unwanted nose hair is time-consuming work.
A cigarette lighter and a small tolerance for pain can accomplish the same goal and save hours.
Note: Its a good idea to keep a bucket of water handy when using this method.

\n

- Redneck Dining Out -
Remember to leave a generous tip for good service. After all
column9:
their mobile home costs just as much as yours.

\n

- Redneck Entertaining in Your Home -
A centerpiece for the table should never be anything prepared by a taxidermist.
Do not allow the dog to eat at the table . . . no matter how good his manners are.
If your dog falls in love with a guest''s leg
column10:
have the decency to leave them alone for a few minutes.

\n

- Redneck Dating (Outside the Family) -
Always offer to bait your date''s hook
column11:
especially on the first date.
Be aggressive. Let her know you are interested: "I''ve been wanting to go out with you since I read that stuff on the men''s bathroom wall two years ago."
If a girl''s name does not appear regularly on a bathroom wall
column12: watertower
column13: or an overpass
column14:
odds are good that the date will end in frustration.

\n

- Redneck Theater Etiquette -
Crying babies should be taken to the lobby and picked up immediately after the movie has ended.
Refrain from talking to characters on the screen. Tests have proven they can''t hear you.

\n

- Redneck Wedding Etiquette -
Livestock is usually a poor choice for a wedding gift.
Its is not okay for the groom to bring a date to a wedding.
When dancing
column15: never remove undergarments
column16:
no matter how hot it is.
A bridal veil made of window screen is not only cost effective but also a proven fly deterrent.
For the groom
column17:
at least rent a tux. A leisure suit with a cummerbundand a clean bowling shirt can create a natty appearance.
Though uncomfortable
column18:
say yes to socks and shoes for this special occasion.

\n

- Redneck Etiquette for All Occasions -
Never take a beer to a job interview or ask if they press charges.
Always identify people in your yard before shooting at them.
Always say "Excuse me" after getting sick in someone else''s car.
It''s considered tacky to take a cooler to church.
Even if you''re certain that you are included in the will
column19:
it''s considered tacky to drive a U-Haul to the funeral home.
The socially refined never fish coins out of public toilets
column20:
especially if other people are around.
Always provide an alibi to the police for family members.]

[David beckham is in a school and he goes into one classroom and says now kids can anyone tell me what a tragedy would be.

\n

One boy sticks his hand up and says "If my friend was playing football in the street and got run over by a car that would be a tragedy".

\n

"No"
column2:
says beckham "That would be described as an accident.

So a girl puts her hand up and says "If a bus carrying about 50 children fell of a cliff and every child died that would be a tragedy".

"Fraid not". says Beckham "That would be a great loss".

So then silence
column3:
no-one answers.

\n

"What"
column4:
says Beckham "Can''t anyone tell me what a tragedy would be".

\n

Eventually little Johnny at the back puts his hand up and says
column5:
"If a plane carrying David Beckham was blown up by a bomb that would be a tragedy".

\n

"Wonderful"
column6:
beams Beckham and he says "Now can you tell me why that would be a tragedy?"

\n

The boy replies
column7: "Well it would not be an accident and it certainly would not be a great loss"]

column1: [Dear Help Desk
column2:
\n

Last year I upgraded from Boyfriend 5.0 to Husband 1.0 and
noticed that the new program began making unexpected changes to
the accounting modules
column3:
limiting access to flower and jewelry
applications that had operated flawlessly under Boyfriend 5.0.

\n

In addition
column4:
Husband 1.0 uninstalled many other valuable
programs
column5:
such as Romance 9.9 but installed undesirable programs
such as NFL 5.0 and NBA 3.0.

\n

Conversation 8.0 no longer runs and HouseCleaning 2.6 simply
crashes the system.

\n

I''ve tried running Nagging 5.3 to fix these problems
column6:
but to no
avail.

Please help!

--Desperate

Dear Desperate
column7:
\n

Please keep in mind that Boyfriend 5.0 is an entertainment
package
column8:
while Husband 1.0 is an operating system.

\n

Try to enter the command: C:/I-THOUGHT-YOU-LOVED-ME and then
install Tears 6.2. Husband 1.0 should then automatically run the
applications: Guilty 3.0 and Flowers 7.0. But remember
column9:
overuse
can cause Husband 1.0 to default to GrumpySilence 2.5
column10:
HappyHour
7.0 or Beer 6.1.

\n

Beer 6.1 is a very bad program that will create "Snoring Loudly"
WAV sound files. DO NOT install MotherInLaw 1.0 or reinstall
another Boyfriend program. These are not supported applications
and will crash Husband 1.0.

\n

In summary
column11: Husband 1.0 is a great program
column12:
but it does have
limited memory and cannot learn new applications quickly.
Consider buying additional software to improve performance.

\n

I personally recommend HotFood 3.0 and Lingerie 5.3

\n

--Help Desk]
